org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class JerseyChannelInboundHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.SimpleChannelInboundHandler<Object>
          • org.microbean.jersey.netty.JerseyChannelInboundHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundHandler

    public class JerseyChannelInboundHandler
extends SimpleChannelInboundHandler<Object>
    A SimpleChannelInboundHandler that adapts Jersey to Netty.

    Thread Safety

    Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but certain methods must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson

      • JerseyChannelInboundHandler

        public JerseyChannelInboundHandler(URI baseUri,
                                   org.glassfish.jersey.server.ApplicationHandler applicationHandler)
        Creates a new JerseyChannelInboundHandler.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - the base URI for the Jersey application; may be null in which case the return value resulting from invoking URI.create("/") will be used instead
        applicationHandler - the Jersey ApplicationHandler that will actually run the Jersey application; may be null in which case a new ApplicationHandler will be used instead

    • Method Detail

      • acceptInboundMessage

        public boolean acceptInboundMessage(Object message)
        Returns true if and only if the supplied message is an instance of HttpRequest, HttpContent, Http2HeadersFrame or Http2DataFrame.
        Overrides:
        acceptInboundMessage in class SimpleChannelInboundHandler<Object>
        Parameters:
        message - the inbound message; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if and only if the supplied message is an accepted type as detailed above; false otherwise
        See Also:
        SimpleChannelInboundHandler.acceptInboundMessage(Object)

      • channelRead0

        protected final void channelRead0(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                  Object message)
                           throws Exception
        Arranges for the ApplicationHandler supplied at construction time to process the HTTP or HTTP/2 message represented by the supplied Object.

        This method must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Specified by:
        channelRead0 in class SimpleChannelInboundHandler<Object>
        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        message - the ByteBufHolder—an HttpRequest or a HttpContent—to process; must not be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is not an instance of any of the following types: HttpRequest, Http2HeadersFrame, HttpContent or Http2DataFrame
        IllegalStateException - if any methods of this class have been overridden incorrectly, or in general if any preconditions have been violated
        Exception - if any other error occurs
        See Also:
        messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, ByteBuf, boolean)

      • createContainerRequest

        protected org.glassfish.jersey.server.ContainerRequest createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                                                              HttpRequest httpRequest)
        Creates a ContainerRequest representing the supplied HttpRequest and returns it.

        This method never returns null.

        Internally, this method sets up an internal ByteBufQueue if necessary representing incoming entity data. The ByteBufQueue in question is an instance of EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream and is also installed on the ContainerRequest.

        This method will be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest to process; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new ContainerRequest; never null
        See Also:
        ContainerRequest, EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream, ByteBufQueue

      • createContainerRequest

        protected org.glassfish.jersey.server.ContainerRequest createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                                                              Http2HeadersFrame http2HeadersFrame)
        Creates a ContainerRequest representing the supplied Http2HeadersFrame and returns it.

        This method never returns null.

        Internally, this method sets up an internal ByteBufQueue if necessary representing incoming entity data. The ByteBufQueue in question is an instance of EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream and is also installed on the ContainerRequest.

        This method will be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        http2HeadersFrame - the Http2HeadersFrame to process; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new ContainerRequest; never null
        See Also:
        ContainerRequest, EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream, ByteBufQueue

      • createContainerResponseWriter

        protected org.glassfish.jersey.server.spi.ContainerResponseWriter createContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                                                                                ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                                                                                Supplier<? extends ScheduledExecutorService> scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier)
        Creates and returns a new ContainerResponseWriter when invoked.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        This implementation simply invokes the HttpContainerResponseWriter.HttpContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest, ChannelHandlerContext, Supplier) constructor and returns the new object.

        In normal usage, this method is invoked in the Netty event loop.

        This method is called by the createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest) method. Overrides must not call that method or an infinite loop may result.

        Parameters:
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest being processed; must not be null
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier - a Supplier that can supply a ScheduledExecutorService; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new ContainerResponseWriter; never null
        See Also:
        HttpContainerResponseWriter.HttpContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest, ChannelHandlerContext, Supplier), createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest)

      • createContainerResponseWriter

        protected org.glassfish.jersey.server.spi.ContainerResponseWriter createContainerResponseWriter(Http2HeadersFrame http2HeadersFrame,
                                                                                                ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                                                                                Supplier<? extends ScheduledExecutorService> scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier)
        Creates and returns a new ContainerResponseWriter when invoked.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        This implementation simply invokes the Http2ContainerResponseWriter.Http2ContainerResponseWriter(Http2HeadersFrame, ChannelHandlerContext, Supplier) constructor and returns the new object.

        In normal usage, this method is invoked in the Netty event loop.

        This method is called by the createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext, Http2HeadersFrame) method. Overrides must not call that method or an infinite loop may result.

        Parameters:
        http2HeadersFrame - the Http2HeadersFrame being processed; must not be null
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier - a Supplier that can supply a ScheduledExecutorService; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new ContainerResponseWriter; never null
        See Also:
        Http2ContainerResponseWriter.Http2ContainerResponseWriter(Http2HeadersFrame, ChannelHandlerContext, Supplier), createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest)

      • copyHeaders

        public static final void copyHeaders(Iterable<? extends CharSequence> nettyHeaderNames,
                                     org.glassfish.jersey.server.ContainerRequest target,
                                     BiConsumer<? super org.glassfish.jersey.server.ContainerRequest,? super CharSequence> headersInstaller)
        A utility method that installs a collection of Netty-sourced HTTP or HTTP/2 headers into the supplied (Jersey) ContainerRequest, using the supplied BiConsumer as a strategy.
        Parameters:
        nettyHeaderNames - an Iterable of CharSequence-typed header names; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        target - the ContainerRequest into which the headers should be installed; must not be null if nettyHeaderNames is non-null
        headersInstaller - a BiConsumer that accepts the supplied ContainerRequest and a CharSequence representing the current header name whose values should be installed; must not be null if nettyHeaderNames is non-null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if target or headersInstaller is null and nettyHeaderNames is non-null
